newsitem.title: UK: UK's Mirror boosts profits despite costs.
newsitem.headline: UK's Mirror boosts profits despite costs.

text.p: British newspaper publisher Mirror Group Plc reported on Wednesday a 2.9 percent increase in pre-tax, pre-exceptional profit to 39.0 million pounds ($60.59 million) despite a large increase in costs.

"Mirror Group has outperformed other newspaper companies in absorbing a 35 percent increase in newsprint costs, maintaining high levels of marketing investment in the brands and still producing an increase in profits," chief executive David Montgomery said in a statement.
"The quality of these results confirms Mirror Group as an efficiently run media business now capable of further expansion by deploying its core skills," Montgomery added.

Mirror Group's flagship newspaper is the tabloid Daily Mirror, Britain's second newspaper in circulation terms. It also has a major stake in The Independent broadsheet and has recently branched out into cable television.
Group turnover increased by 29.4 million pounds to 277.3 million pounds ($430.8 million) in the six months to June 30, thanks to higher circulation and advertising revenue.
Its fledgling Mirror Television arm posted losses of 4.2 million pounds in the period but the company said cable TV revenues had exceeded initial forecasts.
